command.name: re_trigger_options
command.description: changes options for a corresponding trigger

argument.name: mask
argument.description: value represents a bit mask which determines which types of messages can cause activation of a trigger: 1 - pickup messages 2 - death messages 4 - critical messages (most of TeamFortress messages) 8 - chat 16 - centerprint 32 - echo command output 64 - other strings printed in the console The default mask for any trigger equals 31.

argument.name: interval
argument.description: sets a minimal interval of trigger activation (in seconds). If a second activation happened earlier than the value time - it is ignored. Default is 0.

argument.name: final
argument.description: if activation of this trigger happened, the remaining (in the list of triggers) triggers are not checked. Triggers are checked in a reversed order of their definition.

argument.name: notfinal
argument.description: activation of such trigger doesn't stop the checking of other triggers (default).

argument.name: remove
argument.description: a string which caused activation of a trigger is not printed on the screen.

argument.name: noremove
argument.description: a string which caused activation of a trigger is printed on the screen (default).

argument.name: log
argument.description: a string which caused activation of a trigger is not added to a log-file.

argument.name: nolog
argument.description: a string which caused activation of a trigger is added to a log-file (default).

argument.name: noaction
argument.description: a corresponding alias is not executed upon a trigger activation. There is no need to exec alias if all you need is to use remove option :)

argument.name: action
argument.description: a corresponding alias is executed upon a trigger activation (default).

command.remarks:
enable allows activation of a trigger (default). disable prohibits activation of a trigger.
Triggers would not work for debugging messages like snd_show 1. In Team Fortress triggers would not work for commands showloc and id (of enemy), and for message of your dispencer being used by enemies.
